title: 114_s2263
content: The Act is known as the "Honoring Investments in Recruiting and Employing American Military Veterans Act of 2015" or the "HIRE Vets Act". It establishes the HIRE VETS Medallion Program. The HIRE Vets Act establishes a HIRE Vets Medallion Program for employers to voluntarily provide information on efforts to recruit, employ, and retain veterans, as well as support the veteran community through community and charitable services. Employers can apply for a HIRE Vets Medallion Award through a yearly application process. The HIRE Vets Act establishes a program for employers to apply for a HIRE Vets Medallion Award annually by January 31st. Recipients are announced, recognized in the Federal Register, and awarded a HIRE Vets Medallion Certificate. Employers must submit applications by January 31st for the HIRE Vets Medallion Awards to be given in November. The Secretary stops accepting applications by April 30th and completes the review by August 31st. The list of award recipients is determined by September 30th. The Secretary notifies employers of HIRE Vets Medallion Awards by October 11th for the awards in November of each year. SEC. 3. SELECTION OF RECIPIENTS. The Secretary reviews all applications to determine if an employer should receive a HIRE Vets Medallion Award and at what level. Applications must include information on the employer's programs and efforts from the previous calendar year. Each application must also contain a certification signed by the senior executive responsible. The Secretary reviews applications for HIRE Vets Medallion Awards from large employers with 500 or more employees. Employers must meet criteria for Bronze, Silver, or Gold awards, with a certification signed by a senior executive responsible for hiring. Employers applying for HIRE Vets Medallion Awards must meet criteria related to hiring veterans, providing charitable contributions to veteran support organizations, and retaining a percentage of veteran employees. Employers must meet specific criteria to be eligible for a Silver HIRE Vets Medallion Award, including having veterans make up a certain percentage of their workforce. To be eligible for a Gold HIRE Vets Medallion Award, an employer must have a veteran organization, a program to enhance veteran employees' leadership skills, and be eligible for a Silver HIRE Vets Medallion Award. To be eligible for a Silver HIRE Vets Medallion Award, an employer must have veterans make up at least 10% of new hires or 15% of the total workforce. The employer must also retain at least 85% of veteran employees hired in the previous year. To be eligible for a Silver HIRE Vets Medallion Award, an employer must have veterans make up a certain percentage of new hires or the total workforce. The employer must also retain a certain percentage of veteran employees hired in the previous year. Additionally, the employer must provide compensation to employees who are members of the reserve component of the Armed Forces serving on active duty to maintain their income level. Employers seeking a Silver HIRE Vets Medallion Award must meet specific criteria, including hiring and retaining veteran employees, providing compensation to reserve component members on active duty, and offering tuition assistance for veteran employees attending higher education institutions. Smaller employers with 5,000 or fewer employees can qualify if they have at least one HR professional dedicated to veteran employment. Additional criteria may be set by the Secretary. The Secretary may establish additional criteria for HIRE Vets Medallion Awards to determine eligibility. Small and medium-size employers with 50 or fewer employees can qualify for Bronze, Silver, and Gold awards based on specific criteria set by the Secretary. The Secretary will determine the design of the HIRE Vets Medallion Award, which will be in the form of a certificate stating the year it is awarded. The recipient of a HIRE Vets Medallion Award can publicly display the award. It is illegal for an employer to display the award if they did not receive it through the HIRE Vets Medallion Program. The Secretary may assess a fee on employers applying for a HIRE Vets Medallion Award, with fees deposited into the HIRE Vets Medallion Fund. Appropriations are authorized for the first 2 fiscal years for program implementation. Amounts in the HIRE Vets Medallion Fund are available for each fiscal year following fee collections. Appropriated funds remain available until expended for carrying out the Act. SEC. 6. REPORT TO CONGRESS. The Secretary must submit annual reports to Congress on fees collected, program administration costs, number of applications, and awarded Medallion Awards under the HIRE Vets Medallion Program. The Secretary must provide reports to specific Committees in Congress regarding fees collected, program costs, applications, and awarded Medallion Awards under the HIRE Vets Medallion Program. SEC. 7. DEFINITIONS. This Act defines key terms such as "employer," "Secretary," and "veteran" in relation to specific sections of title 38, United States Code.
